snippet: Pedro Hernandez appeared in court Thursday, making his first public appearance since he confessed in May to the 1979 killing of 6-year-old Etan Patz.
abstract: Pedro Hernandez, charged in 1979 murder of Etan Patz, is expected to enter a plea of not guilty; defense attorney Harvey Fishbein says Hernandez's confession was false, the product of a long history of hallucinations and delusions.
lead_paragraph: Pedro Hernandez appeared in court Thursday, making his first public appearance since he confessed in May to the 1979 killing of 6-year-old Etan Patz.

headline.seo: Pedro Hernandez, Suspect in Patz Killing, Appears in Court
headline.main: Suspect in Patz Case Will Plead Not Guilty, Lawyer Says
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Patz Case Will Plead Not Guilty, Lawyer Says
